values.description:
This branch allows SDFormat6 to build and test on Windows. There are only two changes that are required in this repo:

1. We should not copy the `ignition-math4.dll` into the test directories. Instead, that `.dll` should be visible from the `PATH` variable. This practice has already been successfully adopted by `ign-common`, `ign-msgs`, and `ign-transport`. However, this will require additional changes to the `configure.bat` file of `sdformat` as well as the `release-tools` script, which is why this PR is marked as WIP. Nevertheless, removing the code that tries to copy the `.dll` is immediately necessary, because the `${IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARIES}` variable now contains a target name instead of a library path, so that part of the script results in a configuration error if it's left alone.

2. On Windows, elevated privileges are needed in order to create symlinks. Our CI doesn't catch this because it's apparently running with elevated privileges, but users should not have to run in Administrative mode in order for the tests to succeed, so I've simply disabled those tests for MSVC. In `ign-common` we [added a cmake option](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/1fec1f9c5969567b54d2d0234d429035a1b47888/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-25) to toggle those tests. If we care enough about testing the creation of symlinks on Windows, I can add that option to sdformat as well, but it doesn't strike me as very important.

The windows CI changes require [release-tools PR 593](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/593/sdformat-windows-build-use-vs2017-and-ign/diff), which should be merged at the same time as this one.
values.title: Fix Windows support for SDFormat6

summary.raw:
This branch allows SDFormat6 to build and test on Windows. There are only two changes that are required in this repo:

1. We should not copy the `ignition-math4.dll` into the test directories. Instead, that `.dll` should be visible from the `PATH` variable. This practice has already been successfully adopted by `ign-common`, `ign-msgs`, and `ign-transport`. However, this will require additional changes to the `configure.bat` file of `sdformat` as well as the `release-tools` script, which is why this PR is marked as WIP. Nevertheless, removing the code that tries to copy the `.dll` is immediately necessary, because the `${IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARIES}` variable now contains a target name instead of a library path, so that part of the script results in a configuration error if it's left alone.

2. On Windows, elevated privileges are needed in order to create symlinks. Our CI doesn't catch this because it's apparently running with elevated privileges, but users should not have to run in Administrative mode in order for the tests to succeed, so I've simply disabled those tests for MSVC. In `ign-common` we [added a cmake option](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/1fec1f9c5969567b54d2d0234d429035a1b47888/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-25) to toggle those tests. If we care enough about testing the creation of symlinks on Windows, I can add that option to sdformat as well, but it doesn't strike me as very important.

The windows CI changes require [release-tools PR 593](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/593/sdformat-windows-build-use-vs2017-and-ign/diff), which should be merged at the same time as this one.
summary.html:
This branch allows SDFormat6 to build and test on Windows. There are only two changes that are required in this repo:

  1. We should not copy the ignition-math4.dll into the test directories. Instead, that .dll should be visible from the PATH variable. This practice has already been successfully adopted by ign-common, ign-msgs, and ign-transport. However, this will require additional changes to the configure.bat file of sdformat as well as the release-tools script, which is why this PR is marked as WIP. Nevertheless, removing the code that tries to copy the .dll is immediately necessary, because the ${IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARIES} variable now contains a target name instead of a library path, so that part of the script results in a configuration error if it's left alone.

  2. On Windows, elevated privileges are needed in order to create symlinks. Our CI doesn't catch this because it's apparently running with elevated privileges, but users should not have to run in Administrative mode in order for the tests to succeed, so I've simply disabled those tests for MSVC. In ign-common we added a cmake option to toggle those tests. If we care enough about testing the creation of symlinks on Windows, I can add that option to sdformat as well, but it doesn't strike me as very important.

The windows CI changes require release-tools PR 593, which should be merged at the same time as this one.

values.description:
It seems that having `Error` and a `:` on the same line in console output make the jenkins console log parser for msbuild compiler warnings give some false positives from the `INTEGRATION_plugin_include` test:

~~~
[ RUN      ] PluginInclude.PluginMissingFilename
Error [parser_urdf.cc:3166] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:406] parse as old deprecated model file failed.
Error Code: 3 Msg: Required attribute[filename] in element[plugin] is not specified in SDF.
Error Code: 7 Msg: Error reading plugin element
Error Code: 7 Msg: Error reading element <sdf>
[       OK ] PluginInclude.PluginMissingFilename (210 ms)
~~~

The text after `Error Code:` matches the details in the [sdformat6 compiler warnings](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/sdformat-ci-sdformat6-windows7-amd64/3/warnings42Result/).

Removing the `:` keeps the compiler warning parser from getting confused. Hopefully this is an acceptable behavior change.

* :blue_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/399/
values.title: Tweak error output so jenkins doesn't think it's a compiler warning

summary.raw:
It seems that having `Error` and a `:` on the same line in console output make the jenkins console log parser for msbuild compiler warnings give some false positives from the `INTEGRATION_plugin_include` test:

~~~
[ RUN      ] PluginInclude.PluginMissingFilename
Error [parser_urdf.cc:3166] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:406] parse as old deprecated model file failed.
Error Code: 3 Msg: Required attribute[filename] in element[plugin] is not specified in SDF.
Error Code: 7 Msg: Error reading plugin element
Error Code: 7 Msg: Error reading element <sdf>
[       OK ] PluginInclude.PluginMissingFilename (210 ms)
~~~

The text after `Error Code:` matches the details in the [sdformat6 compiler warnings](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/sdformat-ci-sdformat6-windows7-amd64/3/warnings42Result/).

Removing the `:` keeps the compiler warning parser from getting confused. Hopefully this is an acceptable behavior change.

* :blue_circle: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/399/
summary.html:
It seems that having Error and a : on the same line in console output make the jenkins console log parser for msbuild compiler warnings give some false positives from the INTEGRATION_plugin_include test:

[ RUN      ] PluginInclude.PluginMissingFilename
Error [parser_urdf.cc:3166] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:406] parse as old deprecated model file failed.
Error Code: 3 Msg: Required attribute[filename] in element[plugin] is not specified in SDF.
Error Code: 7 Msg: Error reading plugin element
Error Code: 7 Msg: Error reading element <sdf>
[       OK ] PluginInclude.PluginMissingFilename (210 ms)

The text after Error Code: matches the details in the sdformat6 compiler warnings.

Removing the : keeps the compiler warning parser from getting confused. Hopefully this is an acceptable behavior change.

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/399/

values.description:
Added parsing and storage of models to the Root and World classes.

There are more test that can be written, but they will require a refactor of the Error class to include a severity level. For example, an SDF file that contains one model error (such as missing a name attribute) out of many models will fail to load all the models. It would be better to load the models that are correct, and report errors on the models that are invalid.

This will come in a follow on PR.
values.title: World dom

summary.raw:
Added parsing and storage of models to the Root and World classes.

There are more test that can be written, but they will require a refactor of the Error class to include a severity level. For example, an SDF file that contains one model error (such as missing a name attribute) out of many models will fail to load all the models. It would be better to load the models that are correct, and report errors on the models that are invalid.

This will come in a follow on PR.
summary.html:
Added parsing and storage of models to the Root and World classes.

There are more test that can be written, but they will require a refactor of the Error class to include a severity level. For example, an SDF file that contains one model error (such as missing a name attribute) out of many models will fail to load all the models. It would be better to load the models that are correct, and report errors on the models that are invalid.

This will come in a follow on PR.

values.description:
I was testing a urdf today that had the upper and lower joint limits reversed, and the parser swapped them, but the console message was a little funky:

~~~
Warning [parser_urdf.cc:3279] urdf2sdf:
 revolute joint [joint] with limits: lowStop[1.57] > highStop[0x7fb05457aec8], switching the two.
~~~

The code currently prints a pointer address instead of dereferencing it like it does for lowstop, so this adds a dereference.
values.title: parser_urdf: print value of highstop instead of pointer address

I was testing a urdf today that had the upper and lower joint limits reversed, and the parser swapped them, but the console message was a little funky:

 revolute joint [joint] with limits: lowStop[1.57] > highStop[0x7fb05457aec8], switching the two.

summary.html:
I was testing a urdf today that had the upper and lower joint limits reversed, and the parser swapped them, but the console message was a little funky:

Warning [parser_urdf.cc:3279] urdf2sdf:
 revolute joint [joint] with limits: lowStop[1.57] > highStop[0x7fb05457aec8], switching the two.

The code currently prints a pointer address instead of dereferencing it like it does for lowstop, so this adds a dereference.

values.description:
This merged pull request #408 forward, as well as some modifications to the pipelines script, including compiling example code. Enabling this showed that the [dom.cc](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/961e65f2590fe7fd2d9449614f1753a006b12065/examples/dom.cc?at=sdf6&fileviewer=file-view-default) example does not compile:

~~~
examples/dom.cc: In function 'int main(int, char**)':
examples/dom.cc:31:16: error: could not convert 'sdf::Root::Load(const string&)(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>(((const char*)(*(argv + 8u))), std::allocator<char>()))' from 'sdf::Errors {aka std::vector<sdf::Error>}' to 'bool'
   if (root.Load(argv[1]))
                ^
examples/dom.cc:33:10: error: 'class sdf::Root' has no member named 'Print'
     root.Print();
          ^
~~~

@nkoenig do you have any ideas for what this example should do?
values.title: 5 -> 6, don't merge until broken example is fixed

@nkoenig do you have any ideas for what this example should do?
summary.html:
This merged pull request #408 forward, as well as some modifications to the pipelines script, including compiling example code. Enabling this showed that the dom.cc example does not compile:

examples/dom.cc: In function 'int main(int, char**)':
examples/dom.cc:31:16: error: could not convert 'sdf::Root::Load(const string&)(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>(((const char*)(*(argv + 8u))), std::allocator<char>()))' from 'sdf::Errors {aka std::vector<sdf::Error>}' to 'bool'
   if (root.Load(argv[1]))
                ^
examples/dom.cc:33:10: error: 'class sdf::Root' has no member named 'Print'
     root.Print();
          ^

@nkoenig do you have any ideas for what this example should do?

values.description:
* A bunch of fixes to please static analysis.

    clang static analysis points out a number of problems in the
    tests.  A few of these are real; in the unlikely event that
    they ever failed, the test would crash.  The rest are false
    positives in that the test as currently written would prevent
    the crash, but clang throws a warning anyway.  However, we
    can please clang and keep the original intent by switching
    most of these to ASSERT_NE(nullptr, ptr_to_test), which will
    have better error messages anyway.  With this change, sdformat
    is clang static analysis clean.

* Fix memory leaks pointed out by asan.

    Both cases were leaking memory at different points, which building
    with -fsanitize=address pointed out.
values.title: Static analysis fixes

summary.raw:
* A bunch of fixes to please static analysis.

    clang static analysis points out a number of problems in the
    tests.  A few of these are real; in the unlikely event that
    they ever failed, the test would crash.  The rest are false
    positives in that the test as currently written would prevent
    the crash, but clang throws a warning anyway.  However, we
    can please clang and keep the original intent by switching
    most of these to ASSERT_NE(nullptr, ptr_to_test), which will
    have better error messages anyway.  With this change, sdformat
    is clang static analysis clean.

* Fix memory leaks pointed out by asan.

    Both cases were leaking memory at different points, which building
    with -fsanitize=address pointed out.
summary.html:
• A bunch of fixes to please static analysis.

    clang static analysis points out a number of problems in the tests. A few of these are real; in the unlikely event that they ever failed, the test would crash. The rest are false positives in that the test as currently written would prevent the crash, but clang throws a warning anyway. However, we can please clang and keep the original intent by switching most of these to ASSERT_NE(nullptr, ptr_to_test), which will have better error messages anyway. With this change, sdformat is clang static analysis clean.

  • Fix memory leaks pointed out by asan.

    Both cases were leaking memory at different points, which building with -fsanitize=address pointed out.

values.description:
Before: defining a variable with the major version and then calling `find_package` with a package name containing the variable.

After: calling `find_package` with a literal string as the package name (containing the major version) and then defining the variable containing the major version based on the CMake variable provided by the CMake config file.

Advantage: the dependency on `ignition-math4` can be automatically introspected (without the need to evaluate CMake code).
values.title: invert ignition-math version logic

summary.raw:
Before: defining a variable with the major version and then calling `find_package` with a package name containing the variable.

After: calling `find_package` with a literal string as the package name (containing the major version) and then defining the variable containing the major version based on the CMake variable provided by the CMake config file.

Advantage: the dependency on `ignition-math4` can be automatically introspected (without the need to evaluate CMake code).
summary.html:
Before: defining a variable with the major version and then calling find_package with a package name containing the variable.

After: calling find_package with a literal string as the package name (containing the major version) and then defining the variable containing the major version based on the CMake variable provided by the CMake config file.

Advantage: the dependency on ignition-math4 can be automatically introspected (without the need to evaluate CMake code).

values.description:
This purpose of this pull request is to make it easier to include the sdf xml strings directly in libsdformat.so. Double quotes inside the xml would require escaping. Requirement here: https://github.com/RobotLocomotion/drake/issues/7874

The command that was used to produce this PR was:

```
find . -name "*.sdf" -exec sed -i -e 's/"/\x27/g' {} \;
```

and it was run in the `sdf` subdirectory.
values.title: Replace all double quotes with single quotes

values.reason: Need to remove support for older  versions.

values.description:
Remove parsing sdf version 1.0 and 1.2. These versions are very old, and don’t need tick-tock. For reference gazebo2 uses version 1.4 of the sdf spec.

I’ll remove the sdf/1.0 and sdf/1.2 directories in a different pull request.
values.title: Remove <gazebo> from sdf

summary.raw:
Remove parsing sdf version 1.0 and 1.2. These versions are very old, and don’t need tick-tock. For reference gazebo2 uses version 1.4 of the sdf spec.

I’ll remove the sdf/1.0 and sdf/1.2 directories in a different pull request.
summary.html:
Remove parsing sdf version 1.0 and 1.2. These versions are very old, and don’t need tick-tock. For reference gazebo2 uses version 1.4 of the sdf spec.

I’ll remove the sdf/1.0 and sdf/1.2 directories in a different pull request.

values.description:
This will create a `build/src/EmbeddedSdf.hh` file the contains all the SDF specs in `sdf/1.[2-6]`. The `EmbeddedSdf.hh` file is used instead of hitting the filesystem.

This will resolve [https://github.com/RobotLocomotion/drake/issues/7874](https://github.com/RobotLocomotion/drake/issues/7874)

values.description:
It is possible to use different collision detectors in DART. It would be good to be able to specify this in the SDF.

See also [gazebo pull request 2956](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2956/) where support for this is implemented.
values.title: Add collision_detector to dart physics config

summary.raw:
It is possible to use different collision detectors in DART. It would be good to be able to specify this in the SDF.

See also [gazebo pull request 2956](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2956/) where support for this is implemented.
summary.html:
It is possible to use different collision detectors in DART. It would be good to be able to specify this in the SDF.

See also gazebo pull request 2956 where support for this is implemented.
